title: Banksy’s Largest Work Heads to Auction
text:
Text size

Bonhams will offer the largest work ever created by anonymous street artist Banksy—a truck covered in graffiti—in an upcoming auction in London, for up to £1.5 million (US$2 million).

The truck—a Volvo FL6 Box Lorry titled Turbo Zone Truck (Laugh Now But One Day We’ll Be in Charge)—has a painted surface area of 80 square meters (861 square feet), the largest-ever work created by Banksy, according to Bonhams.

The vehicle was presented to Banksy by Mojo, the co-founder of touring company Turbozone International Circus, at an open-air party to celebrate the millennium on a Spanish hillside in 2000, Bonhams said. He started to paint during the party and continued to work on it over the following two weeks.

The images on the truck show the silhouette of a male figure swinging a hammer towards metal cogs, with flying monkeys and red stars on the background. Across the back end and the reverse side of the truck are a group of soldiers running away from a cannon. The title, Laugh Now But One Day We’ll Be in Charge is stenciled above the soldiers’ heads, with the word “charge” in large letters.

“Banksy is arguably the most important artist to have emerged since the millennium and this, his largest commercial work, represents a new high watermark of quality for works of his to appear at auction,” said Ralph Taylor, Bonhams global head of post-war and contemporary art, in a statement. “The composition bears all the hallmarks of this peerless agentprovocateur.” (French for “inciting agent”)

The truck then spent the next years traveling throughout Europe, and as far away as South America, as part of Turbozone’s Cinderella show, Bonhams said. The piece is featured in Banksy’s book, Wall and Piece, published in 2006.

The title of the piece is stenciled above the soldiers' heads. Courtesy of Bonhams

It is being offered for sale at a Bonhams motor car auction, the Goodwood Revival sale, on Sept. 13. The truck is accompanied by a Certificate of Authentication issued by Pest Control, Banksy’s studio.

Banksy is the foremost graffiti artist in the world, with his work adorning streets, walls, and bridges across nations and continents. He rose to international fame in the mid-2000s. His first London exhibition, Crude Oils, in 2005, took aim at the established art world. In 2006, he broke into Hollywood with his show Barely Legal in Los Angeles, Calif., which was attended by stars such as Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie, Dennis Hopper, and Cameron Diaz.

One of Banksy's most famous stunts involves his painting, Girl With Balloon, whichsold for£1.04 million at Sotheby’s London in October 2018. A mechanism triggered the painting to self-shred in the middle of the live auction and created a new piece, titled Love in the Bin (2018).
description: A Volvo truck covered in graffiti could fetch £1.5 million at Bonhams London
